# accessibilityLine(for:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the line number for the line that contains the specified character index.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityLine(for index: Int) -> Int
```

## Parameters

- **index**: The index for a character.

## Return Value

The line number for the line holding the specified character index.

## Configuring text elements

- **accessibilityInsertionPointLineNumber()**: Returns the line number that contains the insertion point.
- **setAccessibilityInsertionPointLineNumber(_:)**: Sets the line number that contains the insertion point.
- **accessibilityNumberOfCharacters()**: Returns the number of characters in the text.
- **setAccessibilityNumberOfCharacters(_:)**: Sets the number of characters in the text.
- **accessibilityPlaceholderValue()**: Returns the placeholder value for the accessibility element.
- **setAccessibilityPlaceholderValue(_:)**: Sets the placeholder value for the accessibility element.
- **accessibilitySelectedText()**: Returns the currently selected text.
- **setAccessibilitySelectedText(_:)**: Sets the currently selected text.
- **accessibilitySelectedTextRange()**: Returns the range of the currently selected text.
- **setAccessibilitySelectedTextRange(_:)**: Sets the range of the currently selected text.
- **accessibilitySelectedTextRanges()**: Returns an array of ranges for the currently selected text.
- **setAccessibilitySelectedTextRanges(_:)**: Sets an array of ranges for the currently selected text.
- **accessibilitySharedCharacterRange()**: Returns the range of characters that the accessibility element displays.
- **setAccessibilitySharedCharacterRange(_:)**: Sets the range of characters that the accessibility element displays.
- **accessibilitySharedTextUIElements()**: Returns the other elements that share text with the accessibility element.
